snippet: A day after the election, the prospect of the country leaving the euro zone loomed large.
abstract: Greece is teetering on the verge of political chaos, with few signs that any party can form a governing coalition and the prospect of the nation leaving the euro zone looming increasingly large; many analysts say that the Greek election and ensuing political tumult show that the country is unable to emerge from its crisis with a government either capable or willing to carry out the strict budget-cutting mandates of its foreign lenders.

byline.original: By RACHEL DONADIO and LIZ ALDERMAN
byline.contributor: Rachel Donadio reported from Athens, and Liz Alderman from Paris. Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens.

lead_paragraph: A day after the election, the prospect of the country leaving the euro zone loomed large.

headline.seo: Greece, in Chaos, Faces Possible New Elections
headline.main: Political Tumult in Greece After Uncertain Elections
headline.print_headline: Political Tumult Engulfs Greece A Day After Vote
